Marion M. Noble Papers
Noble, Marion M., 1911-2002
ALBA.083
0.25 Linear Feet (1 box)
undated
Scope and Contents
Marion M. Noble was born in Arkansas and grew up in dire poverty. As an outgrowth of political consciousness acquired at Commonwealth College (Mena, Arkansas), he became a volunteer in the Spanish Civil War and served in the Abraham Lincoln Brigade. The collection consists of a copy of a typescript autobiography covering the period from his childhood through his return from Spain to New York City in December 1938, as well as his father's life as a railroad laborer and tales of Arkansas life.
